text: The Pad thai , lad nar and various other dishes all look good on paper but , I 've had better thai food in less asthetically pleasing places .
We had a party in their private room and they made it truly memorable and were very helpful in the planning .
The dish had like 6 pieces of beef in it .
The atmosphere is noisy and the waiters are literally walking around doing things as fast as they can .
The place is a BISTRO which means : simple dishes and wine served efficiently in a bustling atmosphere .
The place was real empty but that was because this was the first Sunday they ever opened .

On the other hand , if you are not fooled easily , you will find hundreds of restaurants that will give you service and ambiance that is on par with Alain Ducasse , and food that will outshine in presentaion , taste , choice , quality and quantity .
Super friendly and knowledgable staff , fabulous bistro fare and a wonderful jazz brunch with great live jazz ( the chilaquiles were awesome !
The price is reasonable although the service is poor .
While this is a pretty place in that overly cute French way , the food was insultingly horrible .
I ordered a Lassi and asked 4 times for it but never got it .
Once they ran out of Gnochi and made it for me from scratch !
The freshest , best variety , and the fastest delivery .
Great food ( spinach and corn dumplings and massamman curry ) , very friendly and no nonsense service and a clean and funky bathroom .
I have been to spice three times - twice during lunch and once at dinner .
